prefix_dialog.content: I personally don't know anyone who has died and my nurse friends say it is no worse than the flu. So I try not to worry. What I think about is so critical. I try to pray about what I can't handle, then move on, change my thoughts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Walking is GREAT! This is a lovely time of year too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That was almost 3 months ago and he is still feeling the effects of it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So to recap, find a good friend, get exercise, eat well, talk to people who will try to understand you.  And of course, pray.  The survival rate is 99.996% so the fact that you know no one who died is good news. I had flu like symptoms before this all happened and I still have a cough. They spray the skies too, so I try to not live in fear. There are a lot of consequences to fear, your heart beats faster, you stress yourself out, so it's important to not focus on negativity for too long.

prefix_dialog.content: Hello, how are you doing today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I was looking for some assistance. I lost my job 4 month ago

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Losing your job is one of the biggest stressors in life, how have you been handling it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well first few month was kind off alright, Was looking for a job in different places without success. And now I am really depressed and I feel so useless.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I know what it's like to lose a job, and when it's hard to find a new one it can really make you feel low. What activities have you been doing in addition to seeking new employment?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Nice that you understand me, I was trying job websites alongside with jobcenter in town centre. I have jobseeker allowance but it will not cover the rent

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am living in a high-rent city and the only way I was able to keep my apartment was to find a roommate. Are there ways you can get help from friends or family until a new job opens up?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am renting just a room at the moment, Before I had a girlfriend so we had to split the bill. After she left I had to take all responsibility just on myself to pay bills. I have few friends but don't think they could lend me a lot of money anyway

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: One possible solution, if it's possible for you, could be to sub-lease your room to someone else and stay with friends or family. Even if they can't loan you money, they may be able to let you stay with them for a week while you make money renting your room as an airbnb.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh AirBnB might be a solution actually. I will speak to my cousin if I could stay couple of nights at his place.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What sort of employment are you looking for? Perhaps we can brainstorm some places you can go to make connections for potential work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I was working in IKEA warehouse before I got redundant

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Working in a warehouse shows you have great skills for several other types of jobs. Have you checked small independent-contractor sites like TaskRabbit or Lyft to make extra funds while you search for a new permanent job?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I even haven't heard about those. I am really useless sometimes... What kind of jobs I can find there do you know?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, if you didn't know about them, that's not your fault. It's possible that you could find a new job opportunity while working on smaller tasks or by volunteering for a local organization. You could meet new folks who could provide you with new connections for employment!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I Will definitely try that. You are really helpful. Have you been doing any jobs through those websites?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I am able to make a little spending money by doing small tasks like delivering real estate papers, or delivery take-out food. You can google a list of sites like RentSons.com where you can sign up to do an assortment of tasks, and your warehouse skills will come in handy!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm so confused about what to do next with my job search. I feel like I'm running out of time and options.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed at this stage. Job searching can be a daunting process, especially when results are slow.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Please just tell me what to do. I really need some direction on how to move forward.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm so confused about what to do next with my job search. I feel like I'm running out of time and options.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel overwhelmed at this stage. Job searching can be a daunting process, especially when results are slow.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

samples.situation: 7 weeks ago, my lover and I decided to stop having an affair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't been out to eat for over a year due to the pandemic situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It can be fun! No decisons on who wants to go where. It is all about you enjoying the moment and your own company!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No need to go out if you feel uncomfortable. Find a movie you have been wanting to watch and order some take out! Or do some online shopping while enjoying your favorite dessert or adult beverage!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: During this time with the affair, I had the strength to leave a narcissistic spouse that abused me emotionally. I am proud of myself for that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a lot to handle! I am proud of you for that as well! No one ever deserves to be abused. Some solo time to rebuild your independance may do you wonders and give you back your strength and self confidence! Seems like the past year has been emotionally draining.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It has been. You are right about me focusing on solo time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you know yourself better than anyone else and are about to leap in to a new chapter of your life. You received lessons from both the past relationships and can take that forward knowing what you wish for and deserve.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for letting me talk about this. It is a touchy topic, affairs. My heart was so loved during that time but I always told him that if he needed me to step back, I would. It has been difficult on both of us.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Being a parent, having the families meshed together, homes, work, etc.... I can understand why he feels he should try again.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes talking about why you are feeling is the best way to find closure. Keep the memories of the love and good times but know that in the end you were destined for something so much more. As adults we try so often to find happiness in others. He is a good person for wanting to try to resolve the situation for his family but that does not mean he did not love you or that your relationship was not a bright spot in his life as it was yours. I'm sure he is hurting too.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you so much for saying that. It really means a lot to me and grounds me

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: you are correct, that I need to move forward for me. I deserve it. That's a concept I have been learning.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You deserve peace through this transition. It will take some time but I think you will come out even stronger and happier on the long run. Journaling may be a great outlet for your emotions as well.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank you for that idea. He was my muse in that relationship and I would write beautiful stories and poetry for him. Writing out my journey to the next stage of my life would be beneficail

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think so! It may also let you heal while building your creativity even more! You seem like a very passionate and loving person.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't know what to do about my feelings for him. I feel torn between wanting to move on and the memories of our time together.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel conflicted. Those memories can be powerful, especially when they involve deep emotions.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Can you just tell me what to do? I need some guidance on how to move past this.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I don't know what to do about my feelings for him. I feel torn between wanting to move on and the memories of our time together.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: It started during my childhood, when I was 9 years old, living my father. He had a bad temper and was impatient with me, especially with school. He would raise his voice at me and get physical when I didn't do well in classes. After the age of 10, I ended up living with my mother but I would spend most of my time with my friends because I enjoyed their company more than anything. I started to hate dealing with school because I felt I wouldn't be able to do well in school; I started to get anxiety from dealing with tests and it gotten bad to the point where I couldn't really stay in crowded place as well. Today, I still try my best to tolerate going to college and do my best in classes even when my anxiety comes back.

prefix_dialog.content: I used to be a night owl, going to bed early in the morning.  I reset my schedule very gradually.  I went to bed 15 minutes earlier, and set an alarm for 8 hours later.  I did that for 3 days, then I would ratchet it back another 15 minutes.   It was a gradual process and the only way I could fix it.
